greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ON cells at n-th generation of 1-D CA defined by Rule 150, starting with a single ON cell at generation 0.
comment: Number of 1's in n-th row of triangle in A071036.
Number of odd coefficients in (x^2+x+1)^n. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 05 2003. This result was given in Wolfram (1983). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 17 2015
This is also the odd-rule cellular automaton defined by OddRule 007 (see Ekhad-Sloane-Zeilberger "Odd-Rule Cellular Automata on the Square Grid" link). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 25 2015

This is the Run Length Transform of S(n) = Jacobsthal(n+2) (cf. A001045). The Run Length Transform of a sequence {S(n), n>=0} is defined to be the sequence {T(n), n>=0} given by T(n) = Product_i S(i), where i runs through the lengths of runs of 1's in the binary expansion of n. E.g. 19 is 10011 in binary, which has two runs of 1's, of lengths 1 and 2. So T(19) = S(1)*S(2). T(0)=1 (the empty product). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 05 2014
reference: S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science, Wolfram Media, 2002; Chapter 3.
link: T. D. Noe and N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16383 [First 1024 terms from T. D. Noe]

Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
formula: a(n) = Product_{i in row n of A245562} A001045(i+2) [Sillke]. For example, a(11) = A001045(3)*A001045(4) = 3*5 = 15. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 10 2014
a(2*n) = a(n); a(2*n+1) = a(n) + 2*a(floor(n/2)). - _Peter J. Taylor_, Mar 26 2020
example: May be arranged into blocks of sizes 1,1,2,4,8,16,...:

Apart from the initial 1, the sequence can be written also as an irregular tetrahedron T(s,r,k) = A001045(r+2) * a(k), s>=1, 1<=r<=s, 0<=k<=(A011782(s-r)-1) as shown below (see also _Joerg Arndt_'s equivalent program):
Note that every row r is equal to A001045(r+2) times the beginning of the sequence itself, thus in 3D every column contains the same number.
program: if ( t <= k2 ,  return(  b(s+2) * a(t) ) );
\\ _Joerg Arndt_, Mar 15 2015, from SeqFan Mailing List, Mar 09 2015
